intro: Pyrenocarpa hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan pyrenocarpa, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive fruit structure, with a rough, spiny exterior. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forest growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
